info.title: Direct APIs
info.description: Submit Templates, send Messages & configure Webhooks for inbound & outbound messages

post.summary: Regenerate JWT Bearer Token to Access Direct-APIs
post.description: Regenerate JWT Bearer Token to access all other APIs. This end point uses a base64 encoded token for authorization generated by the following format `<username>:<password>:<projectId>`

direct_api.description: true => Non expiring token / false => Auto-expire in 24hrs

post - copy.summary: Regenerate JWT Bearer Token to Access Direct-APIs
post - copy.description: Regenerate JWT Bearer Token to access all other APIs. This end point uses a base64 encoded token for authorization generated by the following format `<username>:<password>:<projectId>`

direct_api.description: true => Non expiring token / false => Auto-expire in 24hrs

post.description: Use the messages endpoint to send text, media, contacts, locations, and interactive messages, as well as message templates to your customers.

to.description: WhatsApp ID or phone number for the person you want to send a message to.

type.description: The type of message you want to send.

language.description: Contains a language object. Specifies the language the template may be rendered in.

policy.description: The language policy the message should follow. The only supported option is deterministic.

code.description: The code of the language or locale to use. Accepts both language and language_locale formats (e.g., en and en_US).

components.description: Array of components objects containing the parameters of the message.

parameters.description:
Required when type=button.

Array of parameter objects with the content of the message.

type.description:
Describes the parameter type.
Values: text, currency, date_time, image, document, video

Supported Options

header,
body,
button

body.text: Body text of interactive msg here
Body text of interactive msg here

requestBody.description: Example body of /message endpoint refer to https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/on-premises/reference/messages for more details.

post.description: When you receive an incoming message from Webhooks, you can use this endpoint to mark the message as read by changing its status to read. Messages marked as read display two blue check marks alongside their timestamp.

patch.description: You can use this endpoint to change your Webhook url.

get.description: This endpoints returns your currently configured Webhook URL.

post.description: Submit WhatsApp template messages for approval.

components.text: hey how are you.

language.description: The language (and locale) of the content

components.text: Hello {{1}}, this is your template tutorial. This part right here is the body of the message that will be sent to the user.
This portion is the header. Use it as required
Hi {{1}}, this is a sample template with parameters.
Hello dear Mr. {{1}},to resolve your issue please connect with us
Hello dear Mr. {{1}}, would you like to renew your membership?
You can have your header text here
Hello {{1}}, this is a template with header and footer text.
You can write your footer text here
Your physics course {{1}}, is now available in preview?
Retry if this fails
Hello dear Mr. {{1}}, please download the available book list from below:
Reach out to us at 12/1 ABC
Hello dear Mr. {{1}}, please find the lectures for this semester below:
Content is subject to change.
Summer is here, and we have the freshest produce around! Use code {{1}} to get {{2}} off your next order.
Rare lemons for unique cocktails. Use code {{1}} to get {{2}} off all produce.
Exotic fruit for unique cocktails! Use code {{1}} to get {{2}} off all exotic produce.
My first flow template!
Hello dear Mr. {{1}},to resolve your issue please connect with us
Good news, {{1}}! Use code {{2}} to get 25% off on all plans!

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to be selected. Fields must be separated by a comma.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Default  value is 25

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Get next set of results. After token value can be obtain from response.paging

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Get previous set of results. Before token value can be obtained from response.paging

get.description: Get all template messages in a project. You can specify the query params listed below though its completely optional.

components.text: Our {{1}} is on!
Shop now through {{1}} and use code {{2}} to get {{3}} off of all merchandise.
Use the buttons below to manage your marketing subscriptions

Shop now through {{1}} and use code {{2}} to get {{3}} off of all merchandise.
Use the buttons below to manage your marketing subscriptions

get.description: Get details of the template message by its id.

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of your template

delete.description: Delete WhatsApp template message by template name. Refer to WhatsApp policy regarding deleting template messages.

parameters.name: template_name
parameters.description: template name for deletion

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of your template

post.description:
Send a POST request to this endpoint to edit a template.

Limitations:
- Only templates with an APPROVED, REJECTED, or PAUSED status can be edited.
- You can only edit a template's category or components.
- You cannot edit the category of an approved template.
- Approved template can be edited up to 10 times in a 30 day window, or 1 time in a 24 hour window. Rejected or paused templates can be edited an unlimited number of times.
- After editing an approved or paused template, it will automatically be approved unless it fails template review.

components.text: Our {{1}} is on!
Shop now through {{1}} and use code {{2}} to get {{3}} off of all merchandise.
Use the buttons below to manage your marketing subscriptions
Our {{1}} is on!
Shop now through {{1}} and use code {{2}} to get {{3}} off of all merchandise.
Use the buttons below to manage your marketing subscriptions

parameters.name: templateId
parameters.description: Unique identifier of your template

post.description:
You can compare two templates by examining how often each one is sent, which one has the lower ratio of blocks to sends, and each template's top reason for being blocked.

Limitations
- Only two templates can be compared at a time.
- Both templates must be in the same WhatsApp Business Account.
- Templates must have been sent at least 1,000 times in the queries specified timeframe.
- Timeframes are limited to 7, 30, 60 and 90 day lookbacks from the time of the request.

templateIds.description: Template id list to be compared

post.description: Upload media to Meta.
A successful response includes a media object.

get.description: Get details of your Business Profile on WhatsApp

patch.description: Update Profile Picture of your business on WhatsApp

whatsAppAbout.description: The business's About text. This text appears in the business's profile, beneath its profile image, phone number, and contact buttons.

address.description: Address of the business. Character limit 256.

description.description: Description of the business. Character limit 512.

vertical.description:
Accepted Values: 
UNDEFINED
OTHER
AUTO
BEAUTY
APPAREL
EDU
ENTERTAIN
EVENT_PLAN
FINANCE
GROCERY
GOVT
HOTEL
HEALTH
NONPROFIT
PROF_SERVICES
RETAIL
TRAVEL
RESTAURANT
NOT_A_BIZ

email.description: The contact email address (in valid email format) of the business. Character limit 128.

websites.description:
The URLs associated with the business. For instance, a website, Facebook Page, or Instagram. You must include the http:// or https:// portion of the URL.


There is a maximum of 2 websites with a maximum of 256 characters each.

patch.description: Update details of your Business Profile on WhatsApp

get.description: On success, a JSON object is returned with a list of all the business names, phone numbers, phone number IDs, and quality ratings associated with a business.
To get information about a phone number, send a GET request to this endpoint

parameters.name: phoneNumberId
parameters.description: Phone Number ID

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields to be fetched separated by comma. Eg: id, code_verification_status, display_phone_number

get.description:
Get the status of a display name associated with a specific phone number.

The name_status value can be one of the following:

APPROVED: The name has been approved. You can download your certificate now.
AVAILABLE_WITHOUT_REVIEW: The certificate for the phone is available and display name is ready to use without review.
DECLINED: The name has not been approved. You cannot download your certificate.
EXPIRED: Your certificate has expired and can no longer be downloaded.
PENDING_REVIEW: Your name request is under review. You cannot download your certificate.
NONE: No certificate is available.

parameters.name: phoneNumberId
parameters.description: Phone Number ID

get.description: Returns the account information of a WhatsApp Business Account

post.description: Returns analytics and conversation_analytics to get metrics about messages and conversations associated with your WhatsApp Business Account (WABA). Specifically, you can get the number of messages sent and delivered as well as conversation and cost information for a given period.

start.description: The start date for the date range you are retrieving analytics for. This must a unix timestamp in seconds.

end.description: The end date for the date range you are retrieving analytics for. This must be in unix timestamp in seconds.

granularity.description: The granularity by which you would like to retrieve the analytics. For analytics: HALF_HOUR, DAY, MONTH. For conversation_analytics: HALF_HOUR, DAILY, MONTHLY.

requestBody.description: For more information of the fields you can use for filtering in the request body, kindly refer to https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/business-management-api/analytics/ for more details

post.description:
This document describes how to determine whether or not you can send messages successfully using a given API resource.

- WhatsApp Business Account
- WhatsApp Business Phone Number
- WhatsApp Message Template

If you request the health_status field on any of these nodes, the API will return a summary of the messaging health of all the nodes involved in messaging requests if using the targeted node. This summary indicates if you will be able to use the API to send messages successfully, if you will have limited success due to some limitation on one or more nodes, or if you will be prevented from messaging entirely.

requestBody.description: For more information kindly refer to https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/health-status

get.description: Returns the account information of a WhatsApp Business Account
Returns a list of product catalogs. Product catalogs contain a list of items like products, hotels or flights, and the information needed to display them in dynamic ads.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Use the before string in response to go to the previous results
Use the after string in response to go to the next results
parameters.name: after
fields
parameters.description: Fields to be selected. Eg: name,vertical,product_count

post.description: Create a new product catalog. Represents a catalog for your business you can use to deliver ads with dynamic ads.

vertical.description: The type of catalog. Supported values: adoptable_pets, automotive_models, avatar, bookable, commerce, destinations, flights, home_listings, hotels, jobs, local_delivery_shipping_profiles, local_service_businesses, location_based_items, media_titles, offer_items, offline_commerce, test_vertical, ticketed_experiences, transactable_items, vehicle_offers, vehicles

name.description: The name of a catalog given by the creator

product_count.description: The total number of products in a catalog

feed_count.description: The total number of feeds used by a catalog

default_image_url.description: The URL for the default image, which is used for products without images, or when the product image is temporarily unavailable. If a product image matches the default image, this should be treated as if the image was not loaded

fallback_image_url.description: The URL for the fallback image. This is used as the image for auto-generated dynamic items

is_catalog_segment.description: Verify that you will create ads based on a catalog or catalog segment before you try to create Dynamic Ads. Call this field and determine value otherwise you may get and error when you try to create Dynamic Ads from catalog segments.

da_display_settings.description: Image display settings such as background cropping and padding of items in the catalog for different Dynamic Ad formats

carousel_ad.description: Dynamic Ad display settings that would be applied to carousel ads.

transformation_type.description: The type of image transformation that would be applied to the image in a dynamic ad. Supported values: background_cropping_and_padding, background_padding, none

single_ad.description: Dynamic Ad display settings that would be applied to single item ads.

transformation_type.description: The type of image transformation that would be applied to the image in a dynamic ad. Supported values: background_cropping_and_padding, background_padding, none

post.description:
Connect catalog to your WhatsApp Business Account.
Only 1 catalog can be actively connected to a WABA. Inorder to change the catalog first disconnect the old catalog first and then connect with the new one

delete.description: Disconnect catalog to your WhatsApp Business Account.

get.description: Returns a list of Products in a catalog used in Dynamic Ads.

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Use the before string in response to go to the previous results
Use the after string in response to go to the next results
parameters.name: after
catalogId
parameters.description: ID of the catalog whose products you want to fetch

parameters.name: filter
parameters.description: Param filter must be a JSON-encoded string

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to be selected. Eg: name,category,price

product.name: AirMax
product.description: Vibrant shoes suited for comfort and style

product.name: AirMax
product.description: Vibrant shoes suited for comfort and style

post.description: Add a new product to an existing catalog.

Example 1.name: AirMax
Example 1.description: Vibrant shoes suited for comfort and style

category.description: Google product category for the item. If you need a custom category name instead, use field 'product_type'

price.description: Price of the item with 2 digits added for cents (ex: use "100" for 1 or "599" for 5.99

retailer_id.description: A unique identifier for this item (which can be a variant for a product).

description.description: Description of the product item. Max size: 5000

sale_price.description: Sale price of the item with 2 digits added for cents (ex: use "100" for 1 or "599" for 5.99)

sale_price_end_date.description: Date when the sale price ends

sale_price_start_date.description: Date when the sale price starts

value.name: AirMax
value.description: Vibrant shoes suited for comfort and style

requestBody.description: For additional fields and information refer to https://developers.facebook.com/docs/marketing-api/reference/product-catalog/products/

get.description: Returns an individual business phone number's commerce settings.

post.description:
You can enable or disable the shopping cart and the product catalog on a per-business phone number basis. By default, the shopping cart is enabled and the storefront icon is hidden for all business phone numbers associated with a WhatsApp Business Account.

Use this endpoint to enable or disable the shopping cart for a specific business phone number.

requestBody.description: When enabled, cart-related buttons appear in the conversation, catalog, and product details views. When the cart is disabled, customers can see products and their details, but all cart related buttons will not appear in any view.

get.summary: Get All QR Codes & Short Links
get.description: Returns a list of all QR codes on a business phone number.

post.description:
To create a QR code, send a POST request to this endpoint.

In your post body, include an object with a prefilledMessage property set to your message text and a generateQrImage property set to your preferred image format, either SVG or PNG.

patch.description:
To update a QR code, send a PATCH request to this endpoint.

In the patch body, include a qrCodeId property set to the ID of the QR code you wish to update, and a prefilledMessage property set to the new QR code text.

business_public_key_signature_status.description: Status of stored 2048-bit RSA business public key.

get.description: To get a business public key, make a GET request to this endpoint. The phone number must be successfully registered, and the business must have generated a 2048-bit RSA key.

post.description:
To set a business public key using Graph API, make a POST request to this endpoint. In your call, include the 2048-bit RSA key you generated. If you have multiple phone numbers linked to a WABA, this API must be called to sign the business public key for each phone number.

For 2048-bit RSA key generation information refer to 
https://developers.facebook.com/docs/whatsapp/cloud-api/reference/whatsapp-business-encryption

id.description: The unique ID of the Flow.

name.description: The user-defined name of the Flow which is not visible to users.

get.description: To retrieve a list of Flows under a WhatsApp Business Account (WABA), use the following request.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: s to be selected that would be shown in the result. Please enter values commas separated. Accepted Values: id,name.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Get next set of results. After token value can be obtain from response.paging

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Get previous set of results. Before token value can be obtained from response.paging

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Default value is 25

id.description: ID of a Flow returned after calling Create a Flow.

post.description:
To create a Flow, send a POST request to this endpoint.

New Flows are created in DRAFT status. You can then make changes to the Flow by uploading an updated JSON file.

categories.description: A list of Flow categories. Multiple values are possible, but at least one is required. Choose the values which represent your business use case

get.description: This request will return a single Flow's details. By default it will return the fields id,name, status, categories, validation_errors. You can request other fields by using the fields param in the request. The request example below includes all possible fields.

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: List of fields to be selected that would be shown in the result. Please enter values commas separated.

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Flow.

delete.description: While a Flow is in DRAFT status, it can be deleted. Use this request for that purpose.

categories.description: A list of Flow categories. Missing value will keep existing categories. If provided, at least one values is required.

patch.description: After you have created your Flow, you can update the name or categories using the update request.

get.summary: Retrieving a Flow's List of Assets
get.description: Returns all assets attached to a specified Flow.

parameters.name: after
parameters.description: Get next set of results. After token value can be obtain from response.paging

parameters.name: before
parameters.description: Get previous set of results. Before token value can be obtained from response.paging

parameters.name: fields
parameters.description: Fields to be selected. Fields must be separated by a comma.

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: Default value is 25

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Flow.

200.description: Every update request will return validation errors in the Flow JSON, if any.

post.description: To update Flow JSON for a specified Flow, use this request.

preview_url.description: Link for the preview page. This link does not require login and can be shared with stakeholders or embedded in an iframe, but the link will expire in 30 days, or if you call the API with invalidate=true which will generate a new link.

expires_at.description: Time when the link will expire and the developer needs to call the API again to get a new link (30 days from link creation).

id.description: The unique ID of the Flow.

get.description:
In order to visualize the Flows created, you can generate a web preview URL with this request. The preview URL is public and can be shared with different stakeholders to visualize the Flow.

Web preview URLs are only used to visualize how the screens will look - they will not be interactive. The final screens will render slightly differently for the end user.

parameters.name: invalidate
parameters.description: Set this to true only if you want to generate a new link

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Flow.

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Flow.

post.description:
This request updates the status of the Flow to "PUBLISHED". This action is not reversible. The Flow and its assets become immutable once published. To update the Flow after that, you must create a new Flow. You specify the existing Flow ID as the clone_flow_id parameter while creating to copy the existing flow.

You can publish your Flow once you have ensured that:

- All validation errors have been fixed
- The Flow meets the design principles of WhatsApp Flows
- The Flow complies with WhatsApp Terms of Service, the WhatsApp Business Messaging Policy and, if applicable, the WhatsApp Commerce Policy

parameters.name: flowId
parameters.description: The unique ID of the Flow.

post.description: Once a Flow is published, it cannot be modified or deleted, but can be marked as deprecated.

get.description: Get a list of payment configurations linked to the WhatsApp Business Account.
Get a specific payment configuration linked to the WhatsApp Business Account.

post.description: Create a payment configuration.
Regenerate oauth link of payment gateway type payment configuration.

Base64 token.description: this base64 encoded token is generated by encoding the autho `<username>:<password>:<projectId>` in base64.
